spell.name: Aganazzar's Scorcher

components.m: a red dragon's scale

entries: A line of roaring flame 30 feet long and 5 feet wide emanates from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Air Bubble
entries: You create an orb of fresh air that is 1-foot in diameter at a point you can see within range. The orb sticks to the point and follows it for the duration of the spell. That point can be, for example, a creature's head. If the creature breathes air and has multiple heads only one needs to be submerged in the bubble to avoid suffocation, assuming all of the creature's heads share the same respiratory system.

If you wish to cast this spell on an unwilling creature, the duration of the spell changes to concentration, up to 1 minute as you attempt to force it to stay on the point. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC to avoid the spell. While its head is submerged in the air, the creature must hold its breath unless it can breathe air.

A creature may attempt to momentarily escape by using an action to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a success, they are able to get a breath in, resetting their suffocation time.
If this spell is cast on a creature currently under the effects of a {@spell Water Bubble|COOMS} spell, it is dispelled before the effects of this spell take hold.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell on a willing creature using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can create two additional globes of fresh air on willing creatures for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell on an unwilling creature using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by one minute for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Alter Self
entries: You assume a different form. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the spell. While the spell lasts, you can end one option as an action to gain the benefits of a different one.

entries.name: Aerial Wings
entries: You gain lungs and sprout two large animalistic wings out of your back, giving you a flying speed of 20 ft and allowing you to breathe air. These massive wings help stagger surrounding enemies when you take off, allowing you to disengage as a bonus action.

entries.name: Aquatic Adaptation
entries: You adapt your body to an aquatic environment, sprouting gills and growing webbing between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Change Appearance
entries: You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. At any time for the duration of the spell, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your unarmed strikes deal {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you are proficient with your unarmed strikes. Finally, the natural weapon is magic and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can have 2 options active at a time. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of the Natural Weapons increases to {@damage 2d6} and any speed granted by a transformation can be no less than 40 ft. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell is no longer Concentration and the duration changes to be 8 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage of the Natural Weapons increases to {@damage 3d6} and any speed granted by a transformation can be no less than 60 ft. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can have 3 options active at a time. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage of the Natural Weapons increases to {@damage 4d6} and any speed granted by a transformation can be no less than 80 ft. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration changes to be 24 hours.

spell.name: Antagonize

components.m: a playing card depicting a rogue

entries: You whisper magical words that antagonize one creature of your choice within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, treating it as a saving throw against being Frenzied. On a failed save, the target takes {@dice 4d4} psychic damage and must immediately use its reaction to make a melee attack against another creature of your choice that you can see. If the target can't make this attack (for example, because there is no one within its reach or because its reaction is unavailable), the target instead has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Armor of Agathys

components.m: a cup of water

entries: A protective magical force surrounds you, manifesting as a spectral frost that covers you and your gear. You gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the cold damage increase by {@scaledamage 1d8|2-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Drown

components.m: a short piece of flotsam or seaweed

entries: You point at a creature within range. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw or its lungs fill with seawater. Any water the creature hacks or expels from their lungs is immediately recycled back into their lungs. If the creature can't breathe underwater, the creature begins suffocating. A suffocating creature can't speak or perform verbal spell components, and can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round), after which it drops to 0 hit points and is dying. At the end of the creature's turns thereafter, the creature can remake the Charisma saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Avasculate

components.m: a short length of rope stained with blood

entries: You shoot a ray of necromantic energy from your outstretched hand, causing any living creature struck by the ray to violently purge blood (or some other life force, like an elemental's element, a construct's oil, an undead's ichor, etc) is forcefully drawn out through its exterior (on a being with flesh, this may be its skin, but a construct might be its iron body, etc.) Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to forcefully expel the creature's life essence. On a hit, the creature takes necrotic damage equal to half its current hit points (rounded down) and the creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned|phb} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Bane

components.m: a drop of blood

entries: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check before the spell ends, the target must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the {@dice d20} roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Banishing Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, your weapon crackles with force, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 5d10} force damage to the target. Additionally, if this attack reduces the target to 50 hit points or fewer, you banish it. If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the target disappears, returning to its home plane. If the target is native to the plane you're on, the creature vanishes into a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated|phb}. It remains there until the spell ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d10|6-9|1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Bestow Curse
entries: You touch a creature or an effigy of a creature which contains a part of that creature such as a lock of hair, vial of blood, etc., and that creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. Casting through an effigy rather than touching the creature itself raises the casting time to 10 minutes. When you cast this spell, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

items: Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
While cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.
While the target is cursed, your attacks and spells deal an extra {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage to the target.

entries: A {@spell remove curse|COOMS} spell can end this effect. At the DM's option, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The DM has final say on such a curse's effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a 6th level spell slot, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 7th level spell slot, the duration is a tenday. If you use an 8th level spell slot, the duration is a month. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled.

spell.name: Blade Barrier
entries: You create a vertical wall of whirling, razor-sharp blades made of magical energy. The wall appears within range and lasts for the duration. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover to creatures behind it, and its space is {@quickref difficult terrain|phb|3}.
When a creature enters the wall's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature takes {@damage 10d4} slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|8-9|2d4} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Bless

components.m: a sprinkling of holy water

entries: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check before the spell ends, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Blight
entries: Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@dice 8d8} necrotic damage and gains a Tier of Exhaustion on a failed save, or half as much damage with no additional effects on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.
If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw, it simply withers and dies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Blinding Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon flares with bright light, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d8} radiant damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded|phb} until the spell ends.
A creature {@condition blinded|phb} by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition blinded|phb}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Bloodletting

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and must make a Constitution save. On a failed save, the target takes necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1) as blood (or some other life force, like an elemental's element, a construct's oil, an undead's ichor, etc) is forcefully drawn out. A creature immune to necrotic damage automatically succeeds this save. At the end of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes this damage again. On a successful save, or if the creature receives any sort of healing, the spell ends.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 1d4} + mod), 11th level ({@dice 2d4} + mod), and 17th level ({@dice 3d4} + mod).

spell.name: Bones of the Earth
entries: You cause up to six pillars of stone to burst from places on the ground that you can see within range. Each pillar is a cylinder that has a diameter of 5 feet and a height of up to 30 feet. The ground where a pillar appears must be wide enough for its diameter, and you can target the ground under a creature if that creature is Medium or smaller. Each pillar has AC 15 and 50 hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points, a pillar crumbles into rubble, which creates an area of {@quickref difficult terrain|phb|3} with a 10-foot radius that lasts until the rubble is cleared. Each 5-foot-diameter portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.
If a pillar is created under a creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be lifted by the pillar. A creature can choose to fail the save.

If a pillar is prevented from reaching its full height because of a ceiling or other obstacle, a creature on the pillar takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained|phb}, pinched between the pillar and the obstacle. The {@condition restrained|phb} creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (the creature's choice) against the spell's save DC. On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained|phb} and must either move off the pillar or fall off it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can create two additional pillars for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Brimstone

components.m: a holy symbol

entries: You scream and let loose the wrath of a fierce deity scorned as a torrent of magical blood 60 feet long and 5 feet wide unleashes from your mouth in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d12} necrotic damage on a failed save and is coated in the foul blood, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature doused in the brimstone's blood must then make a Constitution saving throw at the start of their turn or become diseased with a random affliction chosen by the DM. If this blood is removed before the start of the creature's turn or if they are already diseased, they do not need to make this save. An action may be used to shake or smear the blood off with a successful Medicine check against your Spell Save DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|4-9|1d12} and the width of the line increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Branding Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike. The attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} radiant damage to the target, which becomes visible if it's {@condition invisible|phb}, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can't become {@condition invisible|phb} until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|2-9|1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Brutality

m.text: jaspers worth at least 110 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature, instilling an instinct of ferocity that allows them to sense the weakness in creatures, inspiring them to capitalize on every advantage they have in combat. For the duration, the creature's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or higher.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the creature's weapon attacks crit on an 18 or higher. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the creature's weapon attacks crit on a 17 or higher. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the creature's weapon attacks crit on a 16 or higher.

spell.name: Camp
entries: You call out to the spirits of nature to aid you. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects:

items: Send the spirits to bring back wood for a fire and to set up a campsite in the area using your supplies. The spirits build the fire in a circle of stones, put up tents, unroll bedrolls, and put out any rations and water for consumption.
Have the spirits instantly break down a campsite, which includes putting out a fire, taking down tents, packing up bags, and burying any rubbish.

entries: The spirits of nature are tricky in nature, and will often include at least one prank with the casting of this spell if it is casted as a ritual.

spell.name: Ceremony

m.text: 25 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a special religious ceremony that is infused with magic. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following rites, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting.

entries.name: Atonement
entries: You touch one willing creature whose alignment has changed, and you make a DC 20 Wisdom (Insight) check. On a successful check, you restore the target to its original alignment.

entries.name: Bless Water
entries: You touch one flask of water and cause it to become holy water or unholy water.

entries.name: Coming of Age
entries: You touch one humanoid who is a young adult. For the next 24 hours, whenever the target makes an ability check, it can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Dedication
entries: You touch one humanoid who wishes to be dedicated to your god's service. For the next 24 hours, whenever the target makes a saving throw, it can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the save. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Funeral Rite
entries: You touch one corpse, and for the next 7 days, the target can't become undead by any means short of a wish spell.

entries.name: Wedding
entries: You touch adult humanoids willing to be bonded together in marriage. For the next 7 days, each target gains a +2 bonus to AC while they are within 30 feet of each other. A creature can benefit from this rite again only if widowed.

spell.name: Chameleon

components.m: a nonliving nonmagical object within range

entries: You take the form of a Large or smaller nonliving nonmagical object within range no smaller than a ball bearing. You are aware of your surroundings and your vision is unaffected by this spell. While in this form, you can only slightly impact your surroundings by doing things like wiggling or other slight motions. Your speed drops to 5 ft, your dexterity drops to 1, you have an AC equal to your Spell Save DC, and you cannot take any actions besides transforming back, which you do by ending {@status concentration|phb|concentration} on the spell. All clothing and gear carried or worn changes with you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Chokesmoke
entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of hot, black smoke with flickering embers inside centered on a point you choose within range. The smoke spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the smoke, ending the spell. Its area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 3d8} Poison and {@damage 3d8} Fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe, though this air is certainly not breathable.
A creature within the smoke that needs to breathe must hold their breath or begin choking, following the standard rules for holding breath and suffocation.
The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rising into the air. The vapors, being lighter than air, rise to the highest level of the land, even pouring through vents.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the size increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Clean/Soil

components.m: a bar of soap or a bucket of mud, which the spell consumes

entries: You change the state of cleanliness within a 10-foot cube, allowing for one of two possible effects:

entries.name: Clean
entries: You remove all of the filth in a 10-foot cube within range. Any nonliving material and any willing creatures within the cube are automatically cleaned. This spell does not fold clothes or tidy in any way besides removing grime. Any unwilling creature must make a Charisma save to resist its effects. An ooze in the area subjected to this spell's effects takes {@damage 5d8} force damage as parts of its body are removed.

entries.name: Soil
entries: You make all willing creatures and nonliving material in a 10-foot cube within range filthy. Any unwilling creature in the area must make a Charisma save to resist its effects. A filthy creature looks like it hasn't washed in a year, and thus the creature makes all charisma checks at disadvantage. Some people may be unwilling to interact with them due to their strong odor. The filth may be removed with a thorough cleaning, through magical or mundane means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the size of the cube increases by 10-feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cloud of Daggers

components.m: a sliver of glass

entries: You fill the air with spinning daggers in a 5-foot radius sphere, centered on a point you choose within range. A creature takes {@damage 4d4} slashing damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|3-9|2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cloud Walk

components.m: a bit of cloud

entries: You bestow up to ten willing creatures you can see within range a flying speed equal to their walking speed. While under the effects of this spell, clouds appear to be a harmless solid ground, and tiny clouds appear beneath their feet any time they take a step. By mimicking walking up or down stairs, you are able to change your elevation.
If you target a creature submerged in a cloud, fog, or mist, the spell carries the target to the surface of the formation at a rate of 60 feet per round.
When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

spell.name: Combustion

components.m: a piece of anthracite coal, held in your hand during the punch, which the spell consumes

entries: Your fist crackles with pyrokinetic energy, ready to release an explosive burst. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d4} fire and {@damage 2d4} thunder damage. The controlled explosion can be heard up to 120 feet away, and it ignites anything not being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the fire damage and the thunder damage increase by {@scaledamage 1d4|2-9|1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Concealed Arms

components.m: a dagger with an inlaid gemstone

entries: You deceive an opponent within range by tricking their mind into seeing a false pair of arms on your person. When you target a creature with this spell, the creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature with truesight automatically makes the save. On a failure, the target sees your arms as doing a different action than the one you're taking, allowing you to make attack rolls against that creature at advantage. Whenever the creature is hit by an attack roll that you make, the creature may remake the save, ending the spell on themselves on a success. This spell lasts until your {@status concentration|phb|concentration} ends or until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, the duration increases to one minute. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, the duration increases to 10 minutes. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell is no longer {@status concentration|phb|concentration}. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, the duration increases to 1 hour. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the duration increases to 8 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, the duration increases to 24 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases to tenday.

spell.name: Conjure Beast
entries: You summon a {@filter beast of challenge rating 4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&4]|type=beast|miscellaneous=!swarm} or lower. It appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The beast disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The beast is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you), as long as they don't violate its alignment. If you don't issue any commands to the beast, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your {@status concentration|phb|concentration} is broken, the beast doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the beast, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled beast can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.
The DM has the beast's statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Conjure Greater Demon

components.m: a vial of blood from a humanoid killed within the past 24 hours

entries: You utter foul words, summoning one demon from the chaos of the Abyss. You choose the demon's type, which must be {@filter one of challenge rating 5 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&5]|tag=demon|miscellaneous=!swarm}, such as a {@creature shadow demon|mm} or a {@creature barlgura|mm}. The demon appears in an unoccupied space you can see within range, and the demon disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

Roll initiative for the demon, which has its own turns. When you summon it and on each of your turns thereafter, you can issue a verbal command to it (requiring no action on your part), telling it what it must do on its next turn. If you issue no command, it spends its turn attacking any creature within reach that has attacked it.

At the end of each of the demon's turns, it makes a Charisma saving throw. The demon has disadvantage on this saving throw if you say its true name. On a failed save, the demon continues to obey you. On a successful save, your control of the demon ends for the rest of the duration, and the demon spends its turns pursuing and attacking the nearest non-demons to the best of its ability. If you stop {@status concentration|phb|concentrating} on the spell before it reaches its full duration, an uncontrolled demon doesn't disappear for {@dice 1d6} rounds if it still has hit points.

As part of casting the spell, you can form a circle on the ground with the blood used as a material component. The circle is large enough to encompass your space. While the spell lasts, the summoned demon can't cross the circle or harm it, and it can't target anyone within it. Using the material component in this manner consumes it when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Conjure Lesser Demons

components.m: a vial of blood from a humanoid killed within the past 24 hours

entries: You utter foul words, summoning demons from the chaos of the Abyss. Roll on the following table to determine what appears.

rows: Two {@filter demons of challenge rating 1 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1]|tag=demon|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Four {@filter demons of challenge rating 1/2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/2]|tag=demon|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Eight {@filter demons of challenge rating 1/4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|tag=demon|miscellaneous=!swarm}

entries: The DM chooses the demons, such as  {@creature manes|mm} or  {@creature dretch|mm|dretches}, and you choose the unoccupied spaces you can see within range where they appear. A summoned demon disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The demons are hostile to all creatures, including you. Roll initiative for the summoned demons as a group, which has its own turns. The demons pursue and attack the nearest non-demons to the best of their ability.

As part of casting the spell, you can form a circle on the ground with the blood used as a material component. The circle is large enough to encompass your space. While the spell lasts, the summoned demons can't cross the circle or harm it, and they can't target anyone within it. Using the material component in this manner consumes it when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 5th-level slot, three times as many with a 7th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

spell.name: Conjure Monsters
entries: You summon monstrosities that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

items: One {@filter monstrosity of challenge rating 2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&2]|type=monstrosity|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Two {@filter monstrosities of challenge rating 1 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1]|type=monstrosity|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Four {@filter monstrosities of challenge rating 1/2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/2]|type=monstrosity|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Eight {@filter monstrosities of challenge rating 1/4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=monstrosity|miscellaneous=!swarm}

entries: A summoned creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the creatures' statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

spell.name: Conjure Monstrosity
entries: You summon a {@filter monstrosity of challenge rating 5 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&5]|type=monstrosity|miscellaneous=!swarm} or lower. It appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The monstrosity disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The monstrosity is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you), as long as they don't violate its alignment. If you don't issue any commands to the monstrosity, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your {@status concentration|phb|concentration} is broken, the monstrosity doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the monstrosity, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled monstrosity can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.
The DM has the monstrosity's statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Conjure Ooze
entries: You summon an {@filter ooze of challenge rating 4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&4]|type=ooze|miscellaneous=!swarm} or lower. It appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The ooze disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The ooze is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you), as long as they don't violate its alignment. If you don't issue any commands to the ooze, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your {@status concentration|phb|concentration} is broken, the ooze doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the ooze, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled ooze can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.
The DM has the ooze's statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Conjure Plant
entries: You summon a {@filter plant of challenge rating 4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&4]|type=plant|miscellaneous=!swarm} or lower. It appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The plant disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The plant is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you), as long as they don't violate its alignment. If you don't issue any commands to the plant, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your {@status concentration|phb|concentration} is broken, the plant doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the plant, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled plant can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.
The DM has the plant's statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Conjure Swarm
entries: You congregate a {@filter swarm of beasts of challenge rating 1/4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=beast|miscellaneous=swarm} or lower. It forms in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The swarm dissipates when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the swarm's statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level, the challenge rating increases to 1/2. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, the challenge rating increases to 1. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Slimes
entries: You summon oozes that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

items: One {@filter ooze of challenge rating 2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&2]|type=ooze|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Two {@filter oozes of challenge rating 1 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1]|type=ooze|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Four {@filter oozes of challenge rating 1/2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/2]|type=ooze|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Eight {@filter oozes of challenge rating 1/4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=ooze|miscellaneous=!swarm}

entries: A summoned creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the creatures' statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

spell.name: Conjure Vegetation
entries: You summon fey spirits that take the form of plants and appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

items: One {@filter plant of challenge rating 2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&2]|type=plant|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Two {@filter plant of challenge rating 1 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1]|type=plant|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Four {@filter plant of challenge rating 1/2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/2]|type=plant|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Eight {@filter plant of challenge rating 1/4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=plant|miscellaneous=!swarm}

entries: Each plant is also considered fey, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the creatures' statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 5th-level slot, three times as many with a 7th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

spell.name: Conscript Beast
entries: You attempt to instill a bonding allegiance with a beast that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the target is charmed, the target regards you and your friends as its friends, and your enemies as its enemies, regardless of its bonds. The target otherwise retains its personality, ideals, and flaws. The target will fight for and alongside you in combat, acting as your ally. The target does not have to follow your orders if they do not want to, but will die to protect you. While you are not in combat, the target will do its best to guard you, but otherwise will behave as normal.
Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conscript Monster
entries: You attempt to instill a bonding allegiance with a creature that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the target is charmed, the target regards you and your friends as its friends, and your enemies as its enemies, regardless of its bonds. The target otherwise retains its personality, ideals, and flaws. The target will fight for and alongside you in combat, acting as your ally. The target does not have to follow your orders if they do not want to, but will die to protect you. While you are not in combat, the target will do its best to guard you, but otherwise will behave as normal.
Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Conscript Person
entries: You attempt to instill a bonding allegiance with a humanoid that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the target is charmed, the target regards you and your friends as its friends, and your enemies as its enemies, regardless of its bonds. The target otherwise retains its personality, ideals, and flaws. The target will fight for and alongside you in combat, acting as your ally. The target does not have to follow your orders if they do not want to, but will die to protect you. While you are not in combat, the target will do its best to guard you, but otherwise will behave as normal.
Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Control Flames
entries: You choose nonmagical flame that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You affect it in one of the following ways:

items: You instantaneously expand the flame 5 feet in one direction, provided that wood or other fuel is present in the new location.
You instantaneously extinguish the flames within the cube.
You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the flame, change its color, or both. The change lasts for 1 hour.
You cause simple shapes such as the vague form of a creature, an inanimate object, or a location to appear within the flames and animate as you like. The shapes last for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three non-instantaneous effects created by it active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Create Bonfire
entries: You create a bonfire on ground that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the magic bonfire fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature that starts its turn in the bonfire's space or moves into the bonfire's space for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} fire damage.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three non-instantaneous effects created by it active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Create or Destroy Water

components.m: a drop of water if creating water or a few grains of sand if destroying it

entries: You either create or destroy water.

entries.name: Create Water
entries: You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames in the area.

entries.name: Destroy Water
entries: You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy nonmagical fog in a 30-foot cube within range. If you target a water-based spell cast at 1st-level with this, such as Fog Cloud or Wall of Water, you dispel it. For any water created by a spell of 2nd-level or higher, make an Arcana check. The DC to dispel the water equals 10 + the spell's level.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the cube increases by 15 feet, for each slot level above 1st. Additionally, you may automatically dispel magical water if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Dancing Lights

components.m: a bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

entries: You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

spell.name: Dark Star

components.m: a black diamond whorth at least 1300 gp and a vial of the caster's blood, both of which the spell consumes

entries: You compact the air within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you see within range until it becomes an unstable black sphere of destructive gravitational force absorbing light around it. For the spell's duration, the sphere and any space within 100 feet of it take twice as much movement to move through, and nonmagical objects fully inside the sphere are destroyed if they aren't being worn or carried.

No air or light can exist within or escape the sphere, nullifying any light or wind-based effects within the area. Not even creatures with truesight can see within the sphere. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

When the sphere appears and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends, unsecured objects within 100 feet of the sphere are pulled toward the sphere's center, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible.

A creature or object that starts its turn within 100 feet of the sphere must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled straight toward the sphere's center, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible. A creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes ({@dice 8d10}) bludgeoning damage, ({@dice 4d10}) cold damage, is considered to be suffocating if it needs to breathe, and is restrained until it is no longer in the sphere. A creature that ends its turn within 100 feet of the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw or take ({@dice 2d10}) radiant damage. If the sphere is in the air, the restrained creature hovers inside the sphere. A creature can use its action to make an {@filter Athletics} check against your spell save DC, ending this restrained condition on itself or another creature in the sphere that it can reach. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is annihilated, along with any nonmagical items it is wearing or carrying.

spell.name: Deflect
entries: Whenever you take damage from a magic missile, attack roll, or are forced to make a saving throw against an attack that deals damage other than psychic in an area of effect, you may use your reaction to reduce the incoming damage roll's outcome (before vulnerability or resistance is calculated) by {@dice 3d4} + spellcasting modifier as you force the attack to curve around you, potentially missing you.

If the incoming damage is from a melee attack and you completely negate the incoming damage, the attacker becomes {@condition Wide Open} as a result of this spell. If you negate the incoming damage by matching their damage roll exactly, the attacker is prevented from attacking for the remainder of their turn, ending an ongoing multiattack or series of attacks granted by the Extra Attack feature.

If the incoming damage is from a ranged attack (including {@spell magic missile|phb}) and you completely negate the incoming damage, you can direct the attack to one creature within 5 feet of you as the shot wraps around you towards them. If the attack roll would hit the creature, the creature takes damage equal to the remainder of the potential damage that you could have negated.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage you can negate increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Destiny Bond

components.m: a foot of adamantine chain

entries: You intertwine your fate with that of another. Choose one creature within range to make a Charisma saving throw, which they can choose to fail. On a failed save, they are cursed with one of these two effects (your choice):

entries.name: Shackles of Pain
entries: Wispy tendrils that have a faded green color and resemble chains connect you to your target. Whenever you take damage the chosen creature takes the same amount of damage of the same type.

entries.name: Soul Mate
entries: Red energy surrounds you and your target, connecting both of you through a semi-opaque trail. Whenever you receive healing, the chosen creature receives the same amount and type of healing.

Regardless of the chosen curse, the spell ends if you drop to 0 hit points or if you and the target become separated by more than 120 feet. The spell fails if you or the target is already being affected by Destiny Bond.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th-level or greater, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Detonate
entries: A great surge of energy swells through your body, turning you into a living bomb. You take {@damage 5d8} fire damage. Every creature within a 30-foot radius of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage equal to twice the number rolled, with half as much on a successful save.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|6-9|1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Dictate

components.m: a writing implement and surface(s) to write on

entries: You verbally designate the writing implement and surface(s) to write on that both fit within a 5-foot cube along with the names of up to four creatures within the range. For the duration, the writing implement magically animates and writes down anything said by the creatures while they are within range of the surface that is being written down on. The writing implement specifies who says what by writing the name assigned to them before what they say whenever the speaker switches. If two or more creatures talk over each other, the writing implement will prioritize creatures in the order that their names were stated.

The writing implement may be ink and quill, blood and a pen, or a dagger, to list some examples. If you choose a combination of writing implement and surface that would be difficult or impossible to write upon, such as a chisel and a stone slab, the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or greater, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Discharge
entries: You cause a great deal of lightning to surge through your body before releasing it in an area around you. You take {@damage 2d4} lightning damage. Afterwards, every creature within 15 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or take lightning damage equal to four times the number rolled, with no damage on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d4|3-9|1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dispelling Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon shatters the ambient magic surrounding the creature, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 4d6} force damage. If the creature is reduced to 50 hit points or fewer and is concentrating on a spell, that concentration is broken.

In addition, any spell of 4th level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 5th level or higher on the target, make an Arcana check. The DC equals 10 + the spells' level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used and the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|5-9|1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Displacement

components.m: a small strip of leather twisted into a loop

entries: Your body appears to be about 2 feet from your actual location, causing attack rolls against you to have disadvantage. If you are hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of your next turn, as you need to shift the projection to a new location to hide where you are once more. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight, as with {@sense blindsight|phb}, or can see through illusions, as with {@sense truesight|phb}.

spell.name: Dragon's Breath

components.m: a hot pepper

entries: You touch one willing creature and imbue it with the power to spew magical energy from its mouth, provided it has one. Choose a dragon type from the table below. Until the spell ends, the creature can use an action to exhale energy in the area listed for the chosen type. Each creature in that area must make a saving throw of the type specified, taking {@damage 3d6} damage of the chosen type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If this spell is cast on a {@race dragonborn|earl}, {@race Human (Dragonheart)|earl|dragonheart}, {@race half-dragon|earl}, {@race kobold|earl}, or {@race Kobold (Winged)|earl|urd} who is of the same type as the one chosen during the spell's casting, they can use the breath weapon of this spell by substituting an attack, rather than as an action.

If this spell is cast on a {@filter dragon|bestiary|type=dragon} who is of the same type as the one chosen during the spell's casting, the dragon's breath weapon recharges automatically for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you are able to choose from the Extended Dragon Types table below (provided you know of the given dragon type's existence) and the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the range of the breath weapons increase to a 30 ft. cone and a 5 by 60 foot line respectively. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the range of the breath weapons increase to a 60 ft. cone and a 10 by 120 foot line respectively.

spell.name: Drown

components.m: a short piece of flotsam or seaweed

entries: You point at a creature within range. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw or its lungs fill with seawater. Any water the creature hacks or expels from their lungs is immediately recycled back into their lungs. If the creature can't breathe underwater, the creature begins suffocating. A suffocating creature can't speak or perform verbal spell components, and can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round), after which it drops to 0 hit points and is dying. At the end of the creature's turns thereafter, the creature can remake the Charisma saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Druidcraft
entries: Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range:

items: You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.
You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.
You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, a puff of wind, the sound of a small animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot cube.
You instantly light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

spell.name: Don/Doff

components.m: wearable equipment within range

entries: You assume an outstretched pose and briefly animate a set of wearable equipment such as a backpack, quiver, or shield, and/or any armor within range, allowing for one of two possible effects:

entries.name: Don
entries: The equipment quickly slots itself onto you where it should be, fastened and ready for use if you can equip it. If you cannot equip any part of the equipment because it is already being worn by another creature or mannequin, broken, too big, too small, or any other reason, the spell fails.

entries.name: Doff
entries: The equipment quickly disrobes off of you, folding up into a backpack if it would fit and one is available. Otherwise, the equipment folds itself neatly beside you. If the equipment is not currently being worn by you, the spell fails.

spell.name: Dote

components.m: an herbalism kit or a healer's kit, a use of which the spell consumes

entries: Using a learned technique that draws a slight amount of magic, one creature other than you that you tend to over the course of the casting time removes 1 tier of exhaustion and regains hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Any creature with a lingering injury that has a set duration removes 4 hours off of the duration. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. If the creature you tend to does anything more strenuous than eating, drinking, or reading during the spell's casting time, the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6} and the lingering injury time reduces by an extra 4 hours for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dust Devil

components.m: a pinch of dust

entries: Choose an unoccupied 5-foot cube of air that you can see within range. An elemental force that resembles a dust devil appears in the cube and lasts for the spell's duration.

Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the dust devil or enters its cube for the first time on a turn must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the dust devil. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. The dust devil's cube counts as difficult terrain.

As a bonus action, you can move the dust devil up to 30 feet in any direction. If the dust devil moves over sand, dust, loose dirt, or light gravel, it sucks up the material and forms a 10-foot-radius cloud of debris around itself that lasts until the start of your next turn. The cloud heavily obscures its area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Electric Current

components.m: a bit of fur and nails connected by copper thread

entries: You shoot a stream of lightning that flows from one target of your choice within range to another. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or else they take {@dice 5d8} lightning damage as electricity jolts through them. The stream then arcs to a different target of your choice within 30 feet of the original target. The new target must then succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or they suffer the same damage and trigger the same effect as the original target. You do not need to see the target for the stream to arc to them, but you need to know of their existence. The stream of lightning may only hit a maximum of 5 creatures or objects in total throughout the spell's duration, and may not target the same creature twice. If a creature ever succeeds the saving throw, they take half damage and the spell ends. If the spell ever deals no damage to a creature or targets a creature outside of the reach that the lightning can jump to, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the amount of maximum targets the stream can jump to increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Elemental Embrasure

m.text: an opal worth at least 750 gp

entries: Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. You create a wall of the chosen type on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

Select one side of the wall. Gouts, geysers, or jets of the chosen element are jettisoned from the wall 10 feet in that direction. When a creature moves within the jets for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there, they must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} of the chosen damage type, with half as much damage on a success. When a creature moves through the wall or starts its turn there, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} of the chosen damage type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|5-9|1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Endure Elements

components.m: a chili pepper and a sprig of mint

entries: You touch a creature and offer it a temperature ward, making it suffer no harm from being in a hot or cold environment. It can exist comfortably in conditions between -50 and 140 degrees Fahrenheit. On top of this, any acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage the warded creature takes is reduced by 1. Any non-creature being worn or carried is likewise protected.
This spell doesn't protect against other environmental hazards such as smoke, lack of air, and so forth.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Enhance Ability

components.m: fur or a feather from a beast

entries: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose one of the following effects; the target gains that effect until the spell ends.

entries.name: Bear's Endurance
entries: The target has advantage on Constitution checks and +1 Constitution. It also gains  {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points, which are lost when the spell ends.

entries.name: Bull's Strength
entries: The target has advantage on Strength checks, +1 Strength, and his or her carrying capacity doubles.

entries.name: Cat's Grace
entries: The target has advantage on Dexterity checks and +1 Dexterity. It also doesn't take damage from falling 20 feet or less if it isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Eagle's Splendor
entries: The target has advantage on Charisma checks and +1 Charisma.

entries.name: Fox's Cunning
entries: The target has advantage on Intelligence checks and +1 Intelligence.

entries.name: Owl's Wisdom
entries: The target has advantage on Wisdom checks and +1 Wisdom.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you raise the Ability Score increase by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Erase

components.m: a quill and writing within range

entries: By wiggling the feather of a quill towards writing within range, you attempt to magically erase writings of either magical or mundane nature from a scroll or from one or two pages of paper, parchment, or similar surfaces. If casted as a ritual, this spell can only remove mundane writing within range. If casted at 1st-level, you may erase any mundane or magical writing cast at 1st-level, such as the text created by an {@spell Illusory Script|COOMS} cast at 1st-level. For any writing created by a spell of 2nd-level or higher, make an Arcana check. The DC to erase the text equals 10 + the spell's level. If you fail the check to erase the writing, there is a chance, such as in the case of a {@spell Glyph of Warding|cooms} or {@spell Symbol|phb} spell, that the effect of the writing triggers. This happens at the discretion of the DM.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may automatically erase and dispel magical text if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Faerie Fire
entries: Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Charisma saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

The affected creature can't benefit from being invisible, allowing creatures to see it by its outline, and any attack roll against the affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it.

spell.name: False Life

components.m: a small amount of alcohol or distilled spirits

entries: Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain {@dice 1d4} + 4 + your spellcasting ability modifier in temporary hit points for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain {@scaledice 1d8|2-9|1d8} additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Fetching Hand
entries: You create the ghostly image of a hand, which you can send to find a creature within 5 miles. The hand then beckons to that creature and leads it to you if the creature is willing to follow.

When the spell is cast, the hand appears in front of you. You then specify a person (or any creature) by physical description, which can include race, gender, and appearance but not ambiguous factors such as level, alignment, or class. When the description is complete, the hand streaks off in search of a subject that fits the description. The amount of time it takes to find the subject depends on how far away they are.

Once the hand locates the subject, it beckons the creature to follow it. If the subject does so, the hand points in your direction, indicating the most direct feasible route. The hand hovers 10 feet in front of the subject, moving before it at a speed of as much as 240 feet per round. Once the hand leads the subject back to you, it disappears.

The subject is not compelled to follow the hand or act in any particular way toward you. If the subject chooses not to follow, the hand continues to beckon for the duration of the spell, then disappears. If the spell expires while the subject is en route to you, the hand disappears; the subject must then rely on her own devices to locate you.
If more than one subject in a 5-mile radius meets the description, the hand locates the closest creature. If that creature refuses to follow the hand, the hand does not seek out a second subject.

If, at the end of 4 hours of searching, the hand has found no subject that matches the description within 5 miles, it returns to you, displays an outstretched palm (indicating that no such creature was found), and disappears.

The ghostly hand has no physical form. It is {@condition invisible|phb} to anyone except you and a potential subject. It cannot engage in combat or execute any other task aside from locating a subject and leading it back to you. The hand can't pass through solid objects but can ooze through small cracks and slits. The hand cannot travel more than 5 miles from the spot it appeared when you cast the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour per spell slot.

spell.name: Find Familiar

m.text: 10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier

entries: You come into accord with and gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that has a reason to follow you and stay in your service, whether they believe that following you might further their goals or cause, or simply receive some reward from doing so. Familiars take the form of an animal you choose (though the familiar has final say in its form): {@creature bat|mm}, {@creature cat|mm}, {@creature crab|mm}, {@creature frog|mm} (toad), {@creature hawk|mm}, {@creature lizard|mm}, {@creature octopus|mm}, {@creature owl|mm}, {@creature poisonous snake|mm}, fish ({@creature quipper|mm}), {@creature rat|mm}, {@creature raven|mm}, {@creature sea horse|mm}, {@creature spider|mm}, or {@creature weasel|mm}. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (depending on the spirit) instead of a beast.
{@note Additional {@filter animal form choices|bestiary|Miscellaneous=Familiar} may be available at the DM's discretion.}

Your familiar acts independently of you, but it almost always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. Should you permit it, a familiar can attack and earn XP alongside you, otherwise it can take actions other than attacking as normal.

When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As an action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the familiar drops to 0 hit points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.

While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are {@condition deafened|phb|deaf} and {@condition blinded|phb|blind} with regard to your own senses.

You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form. Choose one of the forms from the above list. Your familiar transforms into the chosen creature.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

spell.name: Flock of Familiars
entries: You temporarily summon three familiars-spirits that take animal forms of your choice. Each familiar uses the same rules and options for a familiar conjured by the {@spell find familiar|cooms} spell. All the familiars conjured by this spell must be the same type of creature (celestials, fey, or fiends; your choice). If you already have a familiar conjured by the {@spell find familiar|cooms} spell or similar means, then one fewer familiars are conjured by this spell.
Familiars summoned by this spell can telepathically communicate with you and share their visual or auditory senses while they are within 1 mile of you.
When you cast a spell with a range of touch, one of the familiars conjured by this spell can deliver the spell, as normal. However, you can cast a touch spell through only one familiar per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you conjure an additional familiar for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Force Shield

components.m: a spool of thread made of refined metal

entries: A magical barrier with a blue tinge forms around a creature within range, encasing them in a bubble of protection. You may choose to cast this on yourself or another, in each case the spell behaves differently.
When casted with a range of self, you gain additional AC equal to your spellcasting modifier, and take no damage from magic missile.

When casted on a creature within range, ethereal whisps project from yourself towards your target. On this turn and on each of your turns for the duration, you may use your action to give your target additional AC equal to your spellcasting modifier, and they take no damage from magic missile. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th level spell slot, the duration increases to 10 minutes. When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot, the duration increases to an hour. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell is no longer {@status concentration|phb|concentration}. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the duration is 8 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, the duration is 24 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the spell lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Fortune's favor

components.m: a white pearl worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You impart latent luck to yourself or one willing creature you can see within range. When the chosen creature makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw before the spell ends, it can dismiss this spell on itself to roll an additional d20 and choose which of the d20s to use. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the chosen creature, it can dismiss this spell on itself to roll a d20 and choose which of the d20s to use, the one it rolled or the one the attacker rolled.
If the original d20 roll has advantage or disadvantage, the creature rolls the additional d20 after advantage or disadvantage has been applied to the original roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Gift of Alacrity
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target can add {@dice 1d8} to its initiative rolls

spell.name: Glyph of Warding

components.m: Incense and powdered diamond worth at least 200 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, you inscribe a glyph that later unleashes a magical effect. You inscribe it either on a surface (such as a table or a section of floor or wall) or within an object that can be closed (such as a book, a scroll, or a treasure chest) to conceal the glyph.
