The glyph can cover an area no larger than 10 feet in diameter. If the surface or object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast this spell, the glyph is broken, and the spell ends without being triggered.
The glyph is nearly invisible and requires a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|phb}) check against your spell save DC to be found.

You decide what triggers the glyph when you cast the spell. For glyphs inscribed on a surface, the most typical triggers include touching or standing on the glyph, removing another object covering the glyph, approaching within a certain distance of the glyph, or manipulating the object on which the glyph is inscribed. For glyphs inscribed within an object, the most common triggers include opening that object, approaching within a certain distance of the object, or seeing or reading the glyph. Once a glyph is triggered, this spell ends.

You can further refine the trigger so the spell activates only under certain circumstances or according to physical characteristics (such as height or weight), creature kind (for example, the ward could be set to affect {@filter aberrations|bestiary|type=aberration} or {@race Elf (Drow)|earl}), or alignment. You can also set conditions for creatures that don't trigger the glyph, such as those who say a certain password.
When you inscribe the glyph, choose explosive runes, a spell glyph, or a detection glyph.

{@b Explosive Runes.} When triggered, the glyph erupts with magical energy in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the glyph. The sphere spreads around corners. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 5d8} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage on a failed saving throw (your choice when you create the glyph), or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Spell Glyph.} You can store a prepared spell of 3rd level or lower in the glyph by casting it as part of creating the glyph. The spell must target a single creature or an area. The spell being stored has no immediate effect when cast in this way. When the glyph is triggered, the stored spell is cast. If the spell has a target, it targets the creature that triggered the glyph. If the spell affects an area, the area is centered on that creature. If the spell summons hostile creatures or creates harmful objects or traps, they appear as close as possible to the intruder and attack it. If the spell requires concentration, it lasts until the end of its full duration.

{@b Detection Glyph.} When you inscribe this glyph, you link it to an already-existing Glyph of Warding or Symbol within 100 feet of it that was cast by you. That Glyph of Warding or Symbol no longer triggers with the trigger that it was given, and it instead triggers when the detection glyph triggers. After it triggers, both glyphs end. If you choose a glyph or symbol that already has a detection glyph linked to it, the old detection glyph ends as you create the new one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of an explosive runes glyph increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd. If you create a spell glyph, you can store any spell of up to the same level as the slot you use for the glyph of warding.

spell.name: Grasping Vine
entries: You conjure a vine that sprouts from the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. When you cast this spell, you can direct the vine to lash out at a creature within 30 feet of it. You do not need to see the target, but you must know of their existence. If the creature is within 30 feet of the vine, the creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be hooked by the barbed vine and pulled in a straight line to the closest unoccupied space within 5 feet of the vine and become {@condition Restrained|phb}. A creature that starts its turn {@condition Restrained|phb} by the vine takes {@dice 1d8} piercing damage as the thorns dig into it. A creature wishing to cut free or untangle the target from the vine must succeed on an Athletics check against your Spell Save DC to free them as an action.
Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to have the vine strike a new target, letting go of any target it is currently holding onto, if any.
While the vine is active, it occupies its space but creatures can pass through its space as if it were difficult terrain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Gravity Fissure

components.m: a fistful of iron filings

entries: You manifest a ravine of gravitational energy in a line originating from you that is 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Strength saving throw, taking {@dice 8d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Each creature within 10 feet of the line but not in it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@dice 8d8} bludgeoning damage and be pulled toward the line until the creature is in its area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Gravity Sinkhole

components.m: a black marble

entries: A 20-foot-radius sphere of crushing force forms at a point you can see within range and tugs at the creatures there. Each creature in the sphere must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 5d10} bludgeoning damage and is pulled in a straight line toward the center of the sphere, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible (even if that space is in the air). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Grease

components.m: a bit of pork rind or butter

entries: Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into {@quickref difficult terrain|phb|3} for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone|phb}. Any time a creature moves into or within the area, that creature must make the same save or they fall {@condition prone|phb} while they move. A creature trying to stand up must make the save or else they spend half their movement fumbling around.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the size increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Grin
entries: When you make an ability check to interact socially with a creature within range, you flash them a big, wide smile to help gain their favor. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against being charmed. On a failure, you have advantage on the ability check towards that creature. On a success, you have disadvantage on the roll, as the creature knows you attempted to charm it, and the creature is immune to the effects of this spell for 24 hours.

spell.name: Guidance
entries: You touch one willing creature. Anytime that creature makes an ability check while the spell is active, the ability check gains a bonus of {@dice 2d2-2}.
You can target more creatures when you reach higher levels: two creatures at 5th level, three creatures at 11th level, and four creatures at 17th level.

spell.name: Gust
entries: You seize the air and compel it to create one of the following effects at a point you can see within range:

items: One Medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet away from you.

You create a small blast of air capable of moving one object that is neither held nor carried and that weighs no more than 5 pounds. The object is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. It isn't pushed with enough force to cause damage.
You create a harmless sensory effect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters closed, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.

spell.name: Holy Ascension

components.m: a holy relic of your faith

entries: As the seconds go by, you can feel your body increasing with energy. While this spell is active, at the end of each of your turns, set aside a {@dice d4}. The next time a creature hits you with a melee attack, roll every set aside {@dice d4}, as the energy bursts through your gaping wound as a flash of holy light. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take radiant damage equal to the number rolled, with half as much on a successful save.
When the spell ends, the remaining energy bursts from you. Every creature within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the energy burst done at the end of the spell increases its range by 5 ft and its damage by {@scaledamage 2d4|2-9|2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Hoverwalk

components.m: a pair of shoes with feathers sticking out on both sides

entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the creature gains a floating speed equal to their walking speed. The creature will continuously hover 1 foot off the ground and must walk as normal while floating. The creature also gains the following benefits as a result:

items: The creature does not leave tracks.
The creature's footsteps are inaudible.
The creature is not slowed by {@quickref difficult terrain|phb|3}.
Any falling damage the creature takes is reduced by {@dice 1d4}.
The creature can not trigger any floor-based trap such as a tripwire, pressure plate, or any other weighted or floor-based trap.
The creature is unaffected by spells such as {@spell Earth Tremor|xge} or other such spells that rely on using the floor against the creature.

entries: This spell requires you to maintain balance. For example, you still need to walk up slanted surfaces and climb up cliffs. While you are {@condition prone|phb}, this spell confers no benefit to you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hush

components.m: a piece of cotton cloth folded 4 times

entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the sounds the creature makes such as walking, talking, burping, the rustling of their clothes, and other mundane noises are muffled to the point of being barely audible. However, a sound as loud as a scream or fall with substantial weight, such as a drop from 5 feet or more, still produces a muffled sound. Any mundane disadvantage to stealth checks produced by worn armor may be ignored.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by one hour for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Illusory Script

m.text: a lead-based ink worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You write on parchment, paper, or some other suitable writing material and imbue it with a potent illusion that lasts for the duration. The only surface that can't be inscribed with an {@spell Illusory Script|COOMS} is a scroll that has already been inscribed with a spell.

To you and any creatures you designate when you cast the spell, the writing appears normal, written in your hand, and conveys whatever meaning you intended when you wrote the text. To all others, the writing appears as if it were written in an unknown or magical script that is unintelligible. Alternatively, you can cause the writing to appear to be an entirely different message, written in a different hand and language, though the language must be one you know.
Should the spell be dispelled, the original script and the illusion both disappear.
A creature with {@sense truesight|phb} can read the hidden message.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you are able to trap the {@spell Illusory Script|COOMS} with a magical effect that targets any unauthorized readers when they attempt to read the script. Simply glancing at the script is not enough to trigger the magical effect. The magical effect can either be a small suggestion or a spell script.

entries.name: Small Suggestion
entries: An unauthorized creature attempting to read the text triggers a potent illusory effect and must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature that succeeds feels mildly disorientated, but otherwise still sees the illusion as intended. A creature that fails the saving throw is subject to a Small Suggestion implanted in the script by you at the time the {@spell Illusory Script|COOMS} was cast. The Small Suggestion functions like the spell of the similar name, though it only lasts 30 minutes. Typical Small Suggestions include "Close the book and leave", "Forget the existence of the book", and so forth. Once triggered, the Small Suggestion becomes inactive for 10 minutes, after which it is able to activate on the next creature to attempt to read the {@spell Illusory Script|COOMS}.

entries.name: Spell Glyph
entries: When you choose this magical effect, the spell's casting time increases to 8 hours. You can store a prepared spell of a level equal to or less than the level you cast {@spell Illusory Script|COOMS} at to be casted on the reader. The spell must not be of the Abjuration or Evocation schools of magic. When you inscribe the spell, you must also expend an amount of Kraken Ink that would be required for the spell's inscription on a scroll if you were to inscribe it. The spell must target a single creature or an area. The spell being stored has no immediate effect when cast in this way. When the script is triggered, the stored spell is cast. If the spell has a target, it targets the creature that triggered the glyph. If the spell affects an area, the area is centered on that creature. If the spell summons hostile creatures or creates harmful objects or traps, they appear as close as possible to the reader and attack them. If the spell requires {@status concentration|phb|concentration}, it lasts until the end of its full duration. Once the spell's duration is up, the spell can not be triggered in this way again.

spell.name: Immovable Object

components.m: gold dust worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch an object that weighs no more than 10 pounds and cause it to become magically fixed in place. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can move the object normally. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5 feet of the object, suppresses this spell for 1 minute.
If the object is fixed in the air, it can hold up to 8,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the object to fall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases to 24 hours.

spell.name: Legendary Guidance

m.text: a focal stone worth at least 5,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch one willing creature, instilling them with the knowledge to overcome an obstacle that may be in their way in the near future. Once over the course of the next minute, the creature may substitute any ability or tool check they make with a natural and, should it matter, adjusted 20. They choose this after seeing the outcome of the roll but before the DM explains the results of the given check.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, every ability check made for the duration of the spell is treated as a nat 20. When casted in this way, its material component changes to
"a focal stone worth at least 100,000 gp, which the spell consumes"

spell.name: Legendary Resistance

m.text: a focal stone worth at least 7,500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch one willing creature, instilling them with the knowledge to overcome an obstacle that may be in their way in the near future. Once over the course of the next minute, the creature may substitute any ability or tool check they make with a natural and, should it matter, adjusted 20. They choose this after seeing the outcome of the roll but before the DM explains the results of the given check.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, every saving throw made for the duration of the spell is treated as a nat 20. When casted in this way, its material component changes to
"a focal stone worth at least 500,000 gp, which the spell consumes"

spell.name: Legendary Strike

m.text: a focal stone worth at least 10,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch one willing creature, instilling them with the knowledge and skill to overcome any foe that may be in their way in the near future. Once over the course of the next minute, the creature may substitute any attack roll they make with a natural and, should it matter, adjusted 20. They choose this after seeing the outcome of the roll but before the DM explains the results of the given check.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, every attack roll made for the duration of the spell is treated as a nat 20. When casted in this way, its material component changes to
"a focal stone worth at least 1,000,000 gp, which the spell consumes"

spell.name: Lifedrain
entries: When a creature is {@condition grappled|phb} by you, you reach towards a vital spot on that creature as your hand is overwhelmed in necromantic energy. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Incapacitated|phb} for the duration of the spell and have their Max HP reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt by the spell until they take a long rest. If you maintain your {@action grapple|phb} until the start of your next turn, the creature takes {@damage 5d12} Necrotic damage and you are healed for an amount equal to the damage dealt. If you do not maintain your {@action grapple|phb} or if the spell ends early, the creature instead only takes half damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|6-9|1d12} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Lightning Arrow
entries: When you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, the weapon's ammunition, or the weapon itself if it's a thrown weapon, transforms into a bolt of lightning. Make the attack roll as normal. The target takes {@damage 4d8} lightning damage on a hit on top of the weapon's normal damage.

Whether you hit or miss, each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Each of these creatures takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The piece of ammunition or weapon then returns to its normal form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage for both effects of the spell increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Axe
entries: You temporarily manifest an axe made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Each creature in a 15-foot radius (other than you) must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d12} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|4-9|1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Dagger
entries: You temporarily manifest a dagger made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Make a melee spell attack against an enemy within range. If you hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} force damage. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Magic Dart
entries: A small pellet of magical force glowing with energy seeks towards your foes. Make a ranged spell attack against the target at advantage. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} force damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Magic Fang
entries: You touch a part of a creature. Until the spell ends, the natural weapon of that creature that you touched becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls. The spell can affect a slam, fist, bite, claw, or other natural weapon.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the bonus increases to +4. When you use a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the bonus increases to +5.

spell.name: Magic Equipment
entries: You touch a nonmagical piece of equipment including a shield, clothing, or suit of armor. Until the spell ends, that suit of armor becomes magical with a +1 to its AC. Regular clothing counts as AC 10 armor that requires no armor proficiency for the purposes of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3. When you use a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the bonus increases to +4.

spell.name: Magic Greatsword
entries: You temporarily manifest a greatsword made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|6-9|2d4} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Magic Hammer
entries: You temporarily manifest a hammer made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. As the hammer crashes at a point you see within range, each creature in a 40-foot square centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|6-9|2d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Magic Halberd
entries: You temporarily manifest a halberd made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d10|4-9|1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Lance
entries: You temporarily manifest a lance made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Make a melee spell attack against an enemy within range. Each creature in a 100-foot by 15-foot line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d4} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d4|6-9|3d4} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Magic Mace
entries: You temporarily manifest a mace made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. As the mace slams at a point you see within range, each creature in a 20-foot square centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d4} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|4-9|2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Rapier
entries: You temporarily manifest a rapier made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Make a melee spell attack against an enemy within range. Each creature in a 25-foot by 5-foot line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|2-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Magic Scimitar
entries: You temporarily manifest a scimitar made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Each creature in a 7.5-foot radius (other than you) must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|2-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Magic Scythe
entries: You temporarily manifest a scythe made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Each creature in a 30-foot radius (other than you) must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d10|6-9|1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Magic Spear
entries: You temporarily manifest a spear made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Make a melee spell attack against an enemy within range. Each creature in a 50-foot by 10-foot line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|4-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Sword
entries: You temporarily manifest a sword made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 1d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d10|2-9|1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Magic Whip
entries: You temporarily manifest a whip made of magic either in your hand or over your focus, using it as its handle. As the whip cracks at a point you see within range, each creature in a 10-foot square centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d4} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may attack with this spell as many times as you can with a weapon in a given turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|2-9|2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Magnify Gravity
entries: The gravity in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range increases for a moment. Each creature in the sphere on the turn when you cast the spell must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 2d8} bludgeoning damage, and the creature is forced {@condition prone|phb|prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked prone.

Until the start of your next turn, any object that isn't being worn or carried in the sphere requires a successful Strength check against your spell save DC to pick up or move. Additionally, the sphere's space counts as difficult terrain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mass Enhance Ability

components.m: fur or a feather from a beast

entries: You touch up to 4 creatures and bestow upon them a magical enhancement. Choose one of the following effects; the targets gain that effect until the spell ends.

entries.name: Bear's Endurance
entries: The target has advantage on Constitution checks and +3 Constitution. It also gains  {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points, which are lost when the spell ends.

entries.name: Bull's Strength
entries: The target has advantage on Strength checks, +3 Strength, and his or her carrying capacity doubles.

entries.name: Cat's Grace
entries: The target has advantage on Dexterity checks and +3 Dexterity. It also doesn't take damage from falling 20 feet or less if it isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Eagle's Splendor
entries: The target has advantage on Charisma checks and +3 Charisma.

entries.name: Fox's Cunning
entries: The target has advantage on Intelligence checks and +3 Intelligence.

entries.name: Owl's Wisdom
entries: The target has advantage on Wisdom checks and +3 Wisdom.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Mending

components.m: two loadstones

entries: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object. When cast on a construct, the construct may perform a healing surge by expending one of its hit dice and rolling it, regaining hit points equal to the number rolled plus its Constitution modifier.

spell.name: Mental Barrier

time.condition: which you take when you are forced to make an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw

entries: You protect your mind with a wall of looping, repetitive thought. Until the start of your next turn, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and you have resistance to psychic damage.

spell.name: Message

components.m: a short piece of copper wire

entries: You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn't have to follow a straight line and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

spell.name: Mind Thrust
entries: You thrust a lance of psychic disruption into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage, and it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spell's other effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Mold Earth
entries: You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

items: If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn't involve enough force to cause damage.
You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the dirt or stone, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become {@quickref difficult terrain|phb|3}. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already {@quickref difficult terrain|phb|3}. This change lasts for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Motivational Speech
entries: You address allies, staff, or innocent bystanders to exhort and inspire them to greatness, whether they have anything to get excited about or not. Choose up to five creatures within range that can hear you. For the duration, each affected creature gains {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier in temporary hit points and has advantage on Wisdom saving throws. If an affected creature is hit by an attack, it has advantage on the next attack roll it makes. Once an affected creature loses the temporary hit points granted by this spell, the spell ends for that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number of creatures you can target increases by 5 and the temporary hit points increase by {@scaledice 1d8|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Nail The Coffin

m.text: a nail worth at least 3cp

entries: You curse a nail you're holding before attempting to drive it into a creature within range. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, you deal {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage as the cursed nail is driven into their flesh. The creature must then immediately make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is cursed to have the nail remain in their body. While the nail is driven into the creature, the creature cannot regain hit points and has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. On a successful save, the nail is removed from the creature and the creature is no longer cursed. Any time a creature uses its bonus action to attempt to remove the nail, the cursed creature may remake the save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}) and 17th level ({dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Open/Shut
entries: This spell affects up to 6 openings within range such as a container, door, gate, window, or shutter of wood, metal, or stone. You do not need to see the openings but you must know of their existence. For each opening, you may choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Open
entries: You open the object if it is closed and unlocked, unbarred, or unstuck. While under the effects of the spell, the object acts as if it was being held open. If this is cast on an opening that is currently locked, barred, or stuck, the spell fails. A creature that wishes to shut an opening currently under the effects of this spell must make an Athletics check versus your Spell Save DC, closing the object on a success. If the object is forced closed, the spell ends on that object, including if it was subjected to the effects of the Shut option casted by this spell. The object opens as gracefully as the caster wishes, though it can't open with enough force to deal damage. If a creature is in the way of the object opening, they are harmlessly moved out of the way before the object opens at the DM's discretion.

entries.name: Shut
entries: You shut the object if it is open. While under the effects of the spell, the object acts as if it was securely closed and, should the caster choose and if available, mundanely locked or barred. Additionally, the DC to break any part of it or pick any locks on it increases by your spellcasting ability modifier. If the object is forced open, the spell ends on that object, including if it was subjected to the effects of the Open option casted by this spell. The object shuts as quickly as the caster wishes, though it can't shut with enough force to deal damage. If a creature is in the way, they are harmlessly put to the side of the opening they are closest to before the object shuts at the DM's discretion.

The following table gives example DCs for forcing open or breaking down any part of wood, stone, and metal openings that are being held shut by the spell. Bear in mind that these DCs vary depending on a variety of factors, including whether a door is barred, locked, or stuck in any way.
As an action, you may choose to end the effects of this spell on any number of doors it is currently affecting.
Casting {@spell Knock|phb} on the object dispels an active {@spell Open/Shut|COOMS} spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of openings you may affect increases by 10 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Palm
entries: You may cast this spell up to 3 times on your turn. When you cast this spell, choose from the following effects:

entries.name: Abscond
entries: You extend your filled hand(s) forward and state the name of a container on your person. If the container can not fit the object(s) in your hand(s) then the spell fails. The object magically appears in said container, making it no longer a bonus action to stow it.

entries.name: Present
entries: You extend your empty hand(s) forward and state the name of an object on your person that would fit in your hand(s). The object magically appears in your hand(s), making it no longer a bonus action to retrieve it, as if it were in a Handy Haversack or Bag of Holding.

spell.name: Permanency (WIP)

components.m: a varying amount of your XP, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell makes certain other spells permanent. You cast the desired spell and then follow it with the {@spell Permanency (WIP)|COOMS} spell while it is still active. Depending on the spell, you must forfeit a certain amount of XP in order to make the spell permanent. The total XP cost equals the initial cost of the spell cast at its base level plus the upcast fee multiplied by the amount of levels the spell is being upcasted from its base level.
You can make the following spells in regard to yourself:
SELF TABLE

Whenever the above spells are made permanent, they are considered to be attuned to you, and take up an attunement slot as a magic item would. If an attunement slot is not available, the spell fails. If your attunement is ever broken with the spell, it ends. For spells that summon something like a sensor in the case of {@spell Scrying|phb}, or a floating disk like in {@spell Tenser's Floating Disk|phb}, these objects cease to exist once your attunement is broken with the spell.
For spells like {@spell Eyebite|phb} that declare a creature to be immune to the effects of it for the remaining duration of the spell, they are instead only immune for 24 hours.
In addition to personal use, Permanency can be used to make the following spells permanent on yourself, another creature, an area, or an object (as appropriate):
ANYTHING TABLE
When you target a creature other than yourself, and if the creature is willing, you may substitute their XP for yours in the casting of the spell.
For spells that target multiple creatures or areas, {@spell Permanency (WIP)|COOMS} can only be used to make one creature or area attuned to a spell at a time.
The only exception to this are the following spells:
BOND TABLE
When {@spell Permanency (WIP)|COOMS} is cast on the target of these spells, it is applied to two targets. If either person loses attunement, both lose attunement and the spell ends.
The following spells can be cast upon objects or areas only and rendered permanent:
OTHER TABLE

Much like magic items, a creature, item, or area can typically only attune to a maximum of three permanent spells at a time. You can end your attunement to a permanent spell on yourself at any time. You can end your attunement to an area, item or other creature or person only if you are the caster or through the use of spells (see above).

For spells that have a condition that needs to be met for the spell to not end or for spells that have a specific ending condition, such as using all of the charges in a {@spell Soul Cage|xge}, {@spell Permanency (WIP)|COOMS} does not prevent it from ending as per its description.

For spells like {@spell Glyph of Warding|cooms} or {@spell Symbol|phb} that are active until dispelled or triggered, they merely become inactive for 10 minutes once triggered. Though, if a {@spell Glyph of Warding|cooms} was a Spell Glyph, the spell needs to be recast into the glyph in order for it to reform.
If any spell is casted on a corpse and the body is raised, the spell ends, just as it would if it were casted on a person who then died.

If someone wishes to dispel a spell that is under the effects of {@spell Permanency (WIP)|COOMS}, whether that be on a creature or object, the person must roll an arcana check to dispel it, testing against the level the spell was initially casted at. The spell being affected by {@spell Permanency (WIP)|COOMS} is either suppressed for an amount of time or outright dispelled, depending on how much it beats the DC of dispelling the initial spell by.

spell.name: Phantom Trap

m.text: pieces of powdered pyrite worth at least 20 gp sprinkled on the object, which the spell consumes

entries: You sprinkle a bit of pyrite onto any small mechanism or device, such as a lock, hinge, hasp, cork, cap, or ratchet, making it seem to be trapped to anyone who can detect traps or anyone who uses any spell or device enabling trap detection. You determine what sort of trap that seems to exist within reason. For example, you could make a lock seem like it has a harmful trap tied to it, or a lever seem like it has an illusory trap tied to it. Of course, nothing happens if the trap is "sprung" as it is not real. This spell only gives the item an aura of being trapped, and does not actually create any false visuals, auditory hallucinations, or the like.

A creature who wishes to investigate the mechanism needs to roll an Investigation check that passes your Spell Save DC, otherwise they can't get over the feeling that something a trap awaits them should the mechanism be activated.

spell.name: Photosynthesis

components.m: a sunflower that has not yet dried

entries: You touch a willing creature that does not have the Sunlight Sensitivity or Sun Sickness feature. For the duration of the spell, you cause their skin to inherit the nourishing property of plants, allowing them to breathe while in direct sunlight. This does not inhibit their ability to breathe as they normally would. If the creature stays in direct sunlight for at least 1 hour, the creature is fed for 1 day. Every hour after the first restores {@dice 1d2} hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may cast this spell on creatures with the Sunlight Sensitivity feature. For the duration of the spell, they may ignore the Sunlight Sensitivity feature. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may cast this spell on creatures with the Sun Sickness feature. For the duration of the spell, they may ignore the Sun Sickness feature.

spell.name: Pointing Hand
entries: You create a Tiny incorporeal hand of shimmering light in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The hand exists for the duration, but it disappears if you teleport or you travel to a different plane of existence.

When the hand appears, you name one major landmark, such as a city, mountain, castle, battlefield or teleportation circle on the same plane of existence as you. You must have been to this place at least once before. If you have never been to this location, the spell fails. Otherwise, whenever you move toward the hand, it moves away from you at the same speed you moved, and it moves in the direction of the landmark, always remaining 5 feet away from you. If you choose to goad the hand towards you, you may hold the hand. The hand will instead lightly pull you forwards as if leading you to your destination. When you let go, the hand resumes normal behavior.
If you don't move toward the hand, it remains in place until you do and beckons for you to follow once every {@dice 1d4} minutes.

spell.name: Polyglot

components.m: a coin of the local currency

entries: For the duration, a creature you touch can read, write, speak, and understand every common or exotic language as if you are fluent in that language. If you lack the parts to write or speak a language, such as not having an ink and quill or not having the split-jaw of a {@race thri-kreen|earl}, you are still unable to write and speak those languages for which you physically lack the ability to do so.
This spell doesn't decode secret messages, ciphers, arcane text, or any other secret languages like {@language Thieves' Cant|phb} and {@language Druidic|phb}.

spell.name: Prestidigitation
entries: This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

items: You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.
You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Protection from Evil and Good

m.text: holy/unholy water worth at least 6.25 gp per creature or powdered silver/iron worth at least 25 gp per creature, which the spell consumes

entries: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: {@filter aberrations|bestiary|type=aberration}, {@filter celestials|bestiary|type=celestial}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter fey|bestiary|type=fey}, {@filter fiends|bestiary|type=fiend}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead}.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be {@condition charmed|phb}, {@condition frightened|phb}, or possessed by them. If the target is already {@condition charmed|phb}, {@condition frightened|phb}, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Psychic Blast
entries: You unleash a destructive wave of mental power in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 4d8} force damage, is pushed 20 feet directly away from you, and is knocked {@condition prone|phb}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Pulse Wave
entries: You create intense pressure, unleash it in a 30-foot cone, and decide whether the pressure pulls or pushes creatures and objects. Each creature in that cone must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 6d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. And every creature that fails the save is either pulled 15 feet toward you or pushed 15 feet away from you, depending on the choice you made for the spell.
In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the cone are likewise pulled or pushed 15 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the distance pulled or pushed increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Puppet
entries: Your gesture forces one humanoid you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must move up to its speed in a direction you choose. In addition, you can cause the target to either a.) make a single attack against a creature within its range other than itself that you can see, after which the spell ends, or b.) drop whatever it is holding. This spell breaks if the target takes any damage. If you try to force the target onto a point that will cause it direct harm, such as off a cliff or into a pit of spikes, right before they reach the point, the target remakes the save. On a success, the target breaks free of the spell before it moves to the point. This spell has no effect on creatures that are immune to being {@condition charmed|phb}.

spell.name: Quick Attack
entries: When you are targeted as the recipient of a melee attack, your instincts call upon your magic and your body twitches with a burst of speed. You make an {@action Opportunity Attack|phb} against your attacker before they make their attack, potentially causing them to be knocked {@condition unconscious|phb} before they can hit you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, your number of attacks you can make with this {@action Opportunity Attack|phb} increases by 1 for every slot level above 1st, but no more than the maximum number of attacks you can make with a weapon in a given turn.

spell.name: Quill Quilt

components.m: a porcupine's quill and a strand of your own hair

entries: You grow spikes all over your body and on top of your armor that shoot out any time a creature attacks you at close range. Any creature that hits you with a melee attack must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d4} piercing damage, with half as much on a successful save. The next person to take this damage takes a {@damage d4} less, and so on and so forth until this spell deals no {@damage d4}s, in which case it ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|3-9|2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Raise Dead

m.text: a diamond worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You return a dead creature you touch to life, provided that it has been dead no longer than 10 days. If the creature's soul is both willing and at liberty to rejoin the body, the creature returns to life with 1 hit point.

This spell also neutralizes any poisons and cures nonmagical diseases that affected the creature at the time it died. This spell doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, or similar effects; if these aren't first removed prior to casting the spell, they take effect when the creature returns to life. The spell can't return an undead creature to life.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal, causing the target to return to life with 7 Tiers of Exhaustion as the body along with its connection to the soul was weakened during their prolonged separation.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the Tiers of Exhaustion suffered by the target are reduced by 2 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Rapid Fire

m.text: a spellcasting focus worth at least 1 gp

entries: You hold out your spellcasting focus as you channel magic that projects out a constant stream of tiny, burning motes that sear your foes.

Immediately and for the duration of the spell, you may use your action to make your focus shoot three miniature bolts of fire in sequence, slowly turning the point of your spellcasting focus red hot. If you use your action to do anything else, you may instead use a bonus action to shoot one mote of fire.
Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt at a creature within 60 feet one at a time. On a hit, the target takes  {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the rate at which bolts are produced speeds up, allowing you to create one additional bolt per turn when you use your action to fire them for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ravenous Void

components.m: a black diamond worth at least 100 gp and a drop of the caster's blood, both of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell creates a sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The sphere can have a radius of up to 40 feet. The area within this sphere is filled with magical darkness and crushing gravitational force.

For the duration, the spell's area is difficult terrain. A creature with darkvision can't see through the magical darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. No sound can be created within or pass through the area. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

Any creature or object that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Strength saving throw. The creature takes {@dice 8d10} bludgeoning damage on a failed save and is pulled in a straight line toward the center of the sphere, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible (even if that space is in the air). Until the spell ends or they next succeed the spells saving throw, they are also {@condition restrained|phb|restrained}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust.

spell.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
entries: A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores decrease by 1 and they deal half damage with weapon attacks until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the ability scores decrease by an additional point for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Read Magic

components.m: a pair of spectacles

entries: This spell allows you to decipher magical inscriptions on objects-books, scrolls, weapons, and the like-that would otherwise be unintelligible. This grants the following benefits:

items: While copying down magic spells from spellbooks, scrolls, etc., the time it takes is reduced by 6 times. That is to say, if it would normally take 1 hour to copy a spell, while under the effects of Read Magic it would only take 10 minutes instead.

You are able to determine the meaning of written spells, such as spell scrolls, the writing hidden by {@spell Illusory Script|COOMS}, or the purpose of a {@spell Glyph of Warding|cooms} or {@spell Symbol|phb}. You are automatically able to determine the meaning of any spell that was cast at 1st level. For each spell of 2nd level or higher, make an Arcana check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, you are able to determine the script or glyph's meaning.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may automatically determine the meaning of written spells if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Reality Break

components.m: a crystal prism

entries: You shatter the barriers between realities and timelines, thrusting a creature into turmoil and madness. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take reactions until the spell ends. The affected target must also roll a d10 at the start of each of its turns; the number rolled determines what happens to the target, as shown on the Reality Break Effects table.
At the end of each of its turns, the affected target can repeat the Wisdom saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success.

rows: {@b Vision of the Far Realm.} The target takes {@dice 6d12} psychic damage, and it is {@condition stunned|phb|stunned} until the end of the turn.
{@b Rending Rift.} The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 8d12} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Wormhole}. The target is teleported, along with everything it is wearing and carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see. The target also takes {@dice 10d12} force damage and is knocked {@condition prone|phb|prone}.
{@b Chill of the Dark Void.} The target takes {@dice 10d12} cold damage, and it is {@condition blinded|phb|blinded} until the end of the turn

spell.name: Regenerate

m.text: a bottle of holy/unholy water worth at least 37.5 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature and stimulate its natural healing ability. For the duration of the spell, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns (10 hit points each minute). In addition, once per turn for the duration of the spell, the target can choose to perform a healing surge, rolling a hit die to recover HP.

The target's severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored at the end of the spell. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the spell instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, its duration changes to 10 minutes, and the creature instead recovers 6 hit points at the start of its turns. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, its duration changes to 1 minute, and the creature instead recovers 60 hit points at the start of its turns. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, its duration changes to Instantaneous, and the creature recovers 600 hit points and any lost limbs at the casting of the spell.

spell.name: Reincarnate

m.text: rare oils and unguents worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a dead creature or a piece of a dead creature. The creature must be a Monstrosity, Humanoid, Dragon, Giant, or Fey, otherwise the spell fails. The only exceptions to this creature type restriction are the Aasimar, Genasi, Plasmoid, and Tiefling Provided that the creature has been dead no longer than 10 days, the spell forms a new adult body for it and then calls the soul to enter that body. If the target's soul isn't free or willing to do so, the spell fails.

The magic fashions a new body for the creature to inhabit, which likely causes the creature's race to change, along with its gender, height, weight, etc. The DM rolls a {@dice d10000} (which can be done by rolling {@dice 2d100}) and consults the following table to determine what form the creature takes when restored to life, or the DM chooses a form.

spell.name: Remove Curse
entries: At your touch, all curses of 4th level or lower affecting one creature or object end. For each curse of 4th level or higher on the target, make a Religion check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the curse ends. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Repair

components.m: the tool of choice for repairing the given object and any replacement materials

entries: This spell repairs breaks or tears in an object you touch, such as broken chainmail, all parts to a broken sword, a cloak shredded to pieces, or a broken barrel. As long as the breaks or tears are no larger than 5 feet in any dimension, and you have all necessary missing parts and pieces you mend them, leaving no trace of the former damage. The materials you are using to repair an item must be within 30 feet of you, visible to you, and loose. If you do not have all missing parts and pieces, the parts that you do have are slotted where they should be so long as they can be connected. Missing pieces can be replaced so long as you provide enough adequate material to substitute them and the total size of all missing pieces does not exceed 1 cubic foot. If you are substituting parts of a unique or masterwork item, you must succeed a DC 10 Arcana check, otherwise the item, once repaired, is no longer masterwork.

This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object. When cast on a construct, the spell restores {@dice 1d10} + your spellcasting modifier in Hit Points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the healing increases by {@scaledice 1d10|2-9|1d10}, the size of the breaks or tears increases by 5 feet, and the missing pieces threshold increases by 1 foot for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Resistance

components.m: a miniature cloak

entries: You touch one willing creature. Anytime that creature makes a saving throw while the spell is active, the saving throw gains a bonus of {@dice 2d2-2}.
You can target more creatures when you reach higher levels: two creatures at 5th level, three creatures at 11th level, and four creatures at 17th level.

spell.name: Resurrection

m.text: a diamond worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a dead creature that has been dead for no more than a century, that didn't die of old age, and that isn't undead. If its soul is free and willing, the target returns to life with all its hit points.

This spell neutralizes any poisons and cures normal diseases afflicting the creature when it died. It doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, and the like; if such effects aren't removed prior to casting the spell, they afflict the target on its return to life.
This spell closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal, causing the target to return to life with 7 Tiers of Exhaustion as the body along with its connection to the soul was weakened during their prolonged separation.

Casting this spell to restore life to a creature that has been dead for one year or longer taxes you greatly. Until you finish a long rest, you can't cast spells again, and you have disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the Tiers of Exhaustion suffered by the target are reduced by 3 for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Rusting Grasp

components.m: a bit of rust and a drop of water

entries: You touch a piece of metal and cause it to wither and warp, tarnishing it. When you cast this spell on a creature, make a melee spell attack against that creature. On a hit, if the target is made of metal, you can choose to deal {@damage 10d6} acid damage to them. Otherwise, you may instead choose to target one piece of nonmagical metal equipment the target is wearing or carrying. On a hit, roll a {@damage d6}, or {@damage 2d6} on a crit.
If the target was a piece of armor, the armor receives a permanent and cumulative penalty to the AC it offers equal to the number rolled. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

If the target was a shield, the shield receives a permanent and cumulative penalty to the AC, attack, damage, and parrying it offers equal to the number rolled. The shield is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 0.
If the target was a weapon, the weapon receives a permanent and cumulative penalty to its attack and damage rolls equal to the number rolled. If this penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|4-9|1d6} for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Sapping Sting
entries: You jab a creature within range, sapping their vitality. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage and falls {@condition Prone|phb|prone}.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Score

components.m: a conducting rod

entries: You wave your hands or wand in the style of a conductor and music of a style you verbally designate fills the air in a 30-foot radius around you. The music spreads around corners and can be heard from up to 100 feet away. The music moves with you, centered on you for the duration.

When you cast the spell, designate a skill or tool. When the spell is cast and for the duration of the spell, you can use a bonus action to cause you and every creature within 30 feet of you to receive a +3 bonus to that skill or tool. The spell ends if you use your bonus action to do anything else.
If this spell is cast as a ritual, the music plays during the casting time but does not provide any benefits until after the casting time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Searing Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon flares with white-hot intensity, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage to the target and causes the target to ignite in flames. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. On a successful save, the spell ends. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames (such as the target being submerged in water), the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sense Emotion
entries: You attune your senses to pick up the emotions of others for the duration. When you cast the spell, and as an action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your senses on one humanoid you can see within 30 feet of you. You instantly learn the target's prevailing emotion, whether it's love, anger, pain, fear, calm, or something else. If the target isn't actually humanoid or it is immune to being {@condition charmed|phb}, you sense that it is calm.

spell.name: Shape Water
entries: You choose an area of water that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

items: You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn't have enough force to cause damage.
You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You change the water's color or opacity. The water must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You freeze the water, provided that there are no creatures in it. The water unfreezes in 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Shield

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the {@spell magic missile|phb} spell

entries: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you or a creature of your choice within range. This spell can be casted as a bonus action, or as a reaction.
When cast as a bonus action, designate a creature within range. Until the start of your next turn, they have a +5 bonus to AC, and they take no damage from {@spell magic missile|phb}.

When cast as a reaction, you don't have time to place it on someone else, and thus it only has a range of self. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from {@spell magic missile|phb}.

spell.name: Shock Pulse
entries: You shoot out a ball of lightning that flies towards a target of your choosing within range. Make a ranged spell attack, dealing {@dice 3d4} lightning damage on a hit as the ball shocks them. The ball then leaps to a different target of your choice within 30 feet of the original target. Make a ranged spell attack against the new target, triggering the same damage and effect on a hit. You do not need to see the target for the ball to jump to them, but you need to know of their existence. The ball may only hit a maximum of 5 creatures or objects in total throughout the spell's duration, counting repeats. If the ball ever misses, deals no damage, or targets a creature outside the ball's range, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the amount of maximum targets the ball can jump to increases by 2 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sleet Storm

components.m: a pich of dust and a few drops of water

entries: Until the spell ends, freezing rain and sleet fall in a 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it {@quickref difficult terrain|phb|3}. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d4} cold damage and falls {@condition prone|phb}. On a success, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition prone|phb}.

If a creature that doesn't have cold damage immunity starts its turn in the spell's area and is {@status concentration|phb|concentrating} on a spell, the creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or lose {@status concentration|phb|concentration}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d4|4-9|1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Speed Slash

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: Holding out your weapon, you give yourself a burst of speed before your enemies can react. Choose an unoccupied space within range. You may instantly move to that space while making as many attacks as you can with a weapon in a given turn on every enemy in a line to that space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range increases by 10 feet for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spiritual Weapon
entries: You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. The damage type is based on the alignment of your deity: radiant for good, force for neutral, and necrotic for evil.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

While the weapon is active, it occupies its space but creatures can pass through its space. The first time a creature enters the weapon's space on a turn or if it starts its turn there, the weapon attacks them.

The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell's effect resemble that weapon.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Spook
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, gains the following benefits as their feet are swirled with warding magic:

items: The creature does not leave tracks.
The creature's footsteps are inaudible.
The creature gains a bonus to Stealth checks equal to twice your spellcasting ability modifier.
The creature gains a bonus to Dexterity Saves equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

Any falling damage the creature takes is reduced by a number of {@dice d6}s equal to their spellcasting ability modifier, minimum of 1. If the fall damage is reduced to a net of no {@dice d6}s or less by this, their fall does not make noise as the impact is absorbed by the spell. This means that you can fall up to a number of feet equal to ten times your spellcasting ability modifier without taking damage or making sound.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Staggering Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon pierces both body and mind, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 4d6} psychic damage to the target. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and can't take reactions, until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|5-9|1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Starburst

m.text: 1 lb of black powder worth at least 3.5 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: A fizzling multicolored sparkle resembling a star in the sky hisses towards a point you choose within range that you can see before quickly exploding into several smaller fizzling explosions. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius centered on that point must make two saving throws.

The first saving throw is a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. Creatures that fail this save suffer {@damage 4d4} fire damage and the effects of Photosensitivity for 10 minutes on a failed save, giving them disadvantage on attack rolls and perception checks. A creature can remake the save at the end of their turns, ending the effect early on a success. A creature that succeeds the saving throw instead only suffers half damage and no Photosensitivity.

The second is a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. Creatures that fail this save suffer {@damage 8d4} thunder damage and are deafened for 10 minutes on a failed save. A creature can remake the save at the end of their turns, ending the effect early on a success. A creature that succeeds the saving throw instead only suffers half damage and is not deafened.
The explosions are blocked by walls and corners.

If you ritual cast this spell, rather than being a single explosion on a point you can see within range, you create a beautiful hour-long multicolored spectacle in the sky. The material component also increases to
"20 lbs of black powder worth at least 70 gp, which the spell consumes."

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
