entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, both the fire damage and the thunder damage increase by {@scaledamage 1d4|6-9|1d4} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Static Shock

components.m: a bit of rug or carpet

entries: Electricity coats your body in a shocking sheen as you reach your finger towards a creature. Make a melee spell attack against someone within range. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage, and is sheathed in electric energy. Any time the creature hits with a melee attack until the spell ends, the creature is shocked for {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|2-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Static Smite
entries: Before your strike, you hold your weapon to the heavens and it is struck by lightning, coating it in electricity. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, the creature takes an additional {@damage 8d8} lightning damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed|phb}. At the end of each of its turns, the target can remake a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|6-9|1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Steel Wind Strike

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You flourish the weapon used in the casting and then vanish to strike like the wind. Choose up to ten creatures within range. You may make a number of melee attacks against them equal to the number of times you can attack with a weapon in a given turn.
You can then teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets you hit or missed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the number of creatures you can target increases by two for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Stone to Flesh

components.m: a pinch of earth and a drop of blood

entries: You touch a piece of stone, magically converting it into flesh.

Touching a creature of medium size or smaller that is currently {@condition petrified|phb} reverts that creature's body to the way it was before it was {@condition petrified|phb}. This process, however, often caused a shock from the transition. The creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or die from this transition. If the creature does not succeed by 5 or more (DC 20), the creature is also stiff from the transition, leaving the creature with a -4 penalty to all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws that decreases by 1 for every long rest they take until it disappears.

Touching a medium or smaller creature made of stone (e.g. a {@creature Gargoyle|mm}) causes that creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, that creature becomes made of flesh until turned back to stone. The creature loses its damage resistance or damage immunity to non-adamantine or non-magical physical weapons.

Touching a piece of regular stone converts it into pieces of inert flesh lacking a vital life force unless a life force of magical energy is available. For example, a medium-sized statue would become a corpse. You are able to affect an object that fits within a cylinder from 1 foot to 5 feet in diameter and up to 10 feet long or a cylinder of up to those dimensions in a larger mass of stone such as a wall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or greater, the size of creatures you can affect increases by 1 tier and the maximum diameter and length of the cylinder increases by 5 ft for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Sudden Awakening
entries: You evoke a primal sense of danger within those around you. Each sleeping creature you choose within range awakens, every {@condition surprised|phb} creature you choose within range is no longer {@condition surprised|phb}, and each {@condition prone|phb} creature within range you choose can stand up without expending any movement.

spell.name: Sword Burst
entries: You create four spectral blades that shoot out of your front, sides, and back out to 10 feet before vanishing. Create four 10-foot lines at 90-degree angles. Creatures within those lines must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} force damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Tarnishing Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon drips with acid, causing the creature to take an additional {@damage 4d8} acid damage. If the creature is using metal equipment, you may designate one piece of their equipment to focus your strike on. The piece of equipment you designate receives a -1 to its AC. If that piece of equipment is a weapon, it receives a -1 to attack and damage rolls as it's corroded.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|5-9|1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Temporal Shunt

time.condition: taken when a creature you can see makes an attack roll or starts to cast a spell

entries: You target the triggering creature or a creature affected by the triggering action, which must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (it can choose to fail) or vanish, being thrown to another point in time and causing the attack or spell to be delayed. At the start of its next turn, the target reappears where it was or in the closest unoccupied space. The target doesn't remember you casting the spell or being affected by it. If the target that reappears is the triggering creature, it must make an Intelligence saving throw or it takes the triggering action towards the space(s) that it intended to target before it was shunted.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. All targets must be within 30 feet of each other.

spell.name: Thaumaturgy
entries: You manifest a minor wonder, a sign of supernatural power, within range. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

items: Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.
You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Tempo

m.text: a musical instrument worth at least 1 gp

entries: You play a magical tune on your instrument, and a series of arcane notes streak from your instrument towards a target of your choice. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} force damage and you gain advantage on your next attack roll during the spell's duration.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Thought Shield
entries: You weave a clouding veil over the mind of one creature you touch. For the duration, the target's mind can't be read or detected, creatures can't telepathically communicate with the target unless the target allows it, and the target has advantage on saving throws against any effect that would determine whether it is telling the truth.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Thunderous Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon rings with thunder that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} thunder damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Time Ravage

components.m: an hourglass filled with diamond dust worth 5,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You target a creature you can see within range, putting its physical form through the devastation of rapid aging. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@dice 10d12} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the save fails, the target also ages to the point where it has only 30 days left before it dies of old age. In this aged state, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and its walking speed is halved. Only the wish spell or the greater restoration cast with a 9th-level spell slot can end these effects and restore the target to its previous age.

spell.name: Touch of Idiocy
entries: With a touch, you reduce the target's mental faculties. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores decrease by 1 and they deal half damage with spell attacks until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Wisdom saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the ability scores decrease by an additional point for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Toxic Mist
entries: You puff out a spray of noxious gas that quickly dissipates into the surrounding air. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d4} poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned|phb} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature is not {@condition poisoned|phb} and only takes half the initial damage. While {@condition poisoned|phb} in this way, the creature must remake the save on the end of each of its turns. If a creature fails this save, they once again take the damage. On a success, the effect ends on the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|3-9|2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Transparency

components.m: a nightshade petal

entries: A creature you touch becomes semi-transparent until the spell ends. Any creature that would normally see the target at a distance of 15 feet away or more must instead also succeed a Perception check against your Spell Save DC, or else they do not notice the target. Any time the target moves within their line of sight and they would normally see the target, they may remake this save. If the target is within 15 feet of a creature that would normally see them, the creature automatically succeeds this check. If they succeed the check, the target is spotted by the creature and the creature is immune to the effects of this spell for the next hour. Anything that is being worn or carried by the target also becomes semi-transparent. The spell ends for a target that attacks via magical or nonmagical means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tree Shape

components.m: a branch

entries: You take the form of a Large living tree or shrub or a Large dead tree trunk with a small number of limbs. You are aware of your surroundings and your vision is unaffected by this spell. While in this form, your speed and Dexterity drop to 0, you have an AC of 16, and you cannot take any actions besides transforming back, which you do by ending {@status concentration|phb|concentration} on the spell. All clothing and gear carried or worn changes with you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Twister
entries: A gale whose wind cuts like a blade swirls tightly around a creature of your choosing within range, attempting to topple them over. The creature must succeed a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} slashing damage and be carried up to a number of feet proportionate to their size in a direction of your choice. For example, a tiny creature is carried up to 2.5 feet, a small/medium creature is carried up to 5 feet, a large creature is carried up to 10 feet, etc. If the creature moves at least a number of feet proportionate to their size once, they are also knocked {@condition prone|phb}. If the creature comes into contact with a wall, creature, or some other stopping force, the creature stops moving. A creature who succeeds the saving throw only takes half damage and is not swept with the gale and therefore cannot be knocked {@condition prone|phb} as well.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d10|2-9|1d10} and the amount of feet they are carried is multiplied by the spell's level for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: True Strike
entries: You touch one willing creature. Anytime that creature makes an attack roll while the spell is active, the attack roll gains a bonus of {@dice 2d2-2}.
You can target more creatures when you reach higher levels: two creatures at 5th level, three creatures at 11th level, and four creatures at 17th level.

spell.name: Virtue

components.m: a holy symbol

entries: You touch one creature, imbuing it with vitality. If the target has at least 1 hit point, it gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d(your spellcasting ability modifier), minimum of 1. The temporary hit points are lost when the spell ends at the start of your next turn. If the target already has temporary hit points equal to or greater than the number rolled, the spell fails.

You can target more creatures when you reach higher levels: two creatures at 5th level, three creatures at 11th level, and four creatures at 17th level. You can cast this spell repeatedly on the same creature to reroll poor temporary hit point rolls or on different creatures.

spell.name: Volatility

m.text: opals worth at least 325 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature, causing the magic within them to surge, causing occasional bursts of power when they cast spells. For the duration, the creature's spell attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or higher.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the creature's spell attacks crit on an 18 or higher. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the creature's spell attacks crit on a 17 or higher.

spell.name: Vortex Warp

components.m: a black pearl worth 500 gp

entries: You magically twist space around a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (the target can choose to fail), or the target is teleported to a space of your choice that you can see within range. The chosen space must be on a surface or in a liquid that can support the target without the target having to squeeze after the teleport.

If you attempt to teleport the creature to an occupied space, the creature occupying that space must also make a Charisma saving throw (that it can choose to fail), or the two creatures swap places. If either of the creatures' spaces violate the stipulations listed above for the creatures they are swapping with, the spell fails for those creatures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the distance increases by 30 feet and you are able to target an additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wall of Sand

components.m: a handful of sand

entries: You create a wall of swirling sand on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 10 feet thick, and it vanishes when the spell ends. It blocks line of sight but not movement. A creature is {@condition blinded|phb} while in the wall's space and must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves there.

spell.name: Wall of Force

components.m: a pinch of powder made by crushing a clear gemstone

entries: An invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick. It lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by {@spell dispel magic|phb}. A {@spell disintegrate|phb} spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through the wall.

spell.name: Wall of Water

components.m: a drop of water

entries: You create a wall of water on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or you can make a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall vanishes when the spell ends.

Any ranged weapon attack that enters the wall's space has disadvantage on the attack roll. Any acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage is halved if the effect passes through the wall to reach its target.

Spells that deal lightning damage that pass through the wall electrify the wall. Any creature that enters the wall or starts its turn in it next must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.

Spells that deal cold damage that pass through the wall cause the area of the wall they pass through to freeze solid (at least a 5-foot-square section is frozen). Each 5-foot-square frozen section has AC 5 and 15 hit points. Reducing a frozen section to 0 hit points destroys it. When a section is destroyed, the wall's water doesn't fill it.

spell.name: Wall of Wind

components.m: a tiny fan and a feather of exotic origin

entries: A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the duration.

When a creature moves through the wall for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there, they must make a Strength saving throw or be flung up to 30 feet, taking falling damage and landing {@condition prone|phb} as necessary. A creature flung into a ceiling takes {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage, regardless of distance.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gasses at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. {@item Arrow|owl|Arrows}, {@item Crossbow Bolt|owl|bolts}, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically miss. (Boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.) Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

spell.name: Water Bubble
entries: You create an orb of saltwater that is 1-foot in diameter at a point you can see within range. The orb sticks to the point and follows it for the duration of the spell. That point can be, for example, a creature's head. If the creature breathes water and has multiple heads only one needs to be submerged in the bubble to avoid suffocation, assuming all of the creature's heads share the same respiratory system.

If you wish to cast this spell on an unwilling creature, the duration of the spell changes to {@status concentration|phb|concentration}, up to 1 minute as you attempt to force it to stay on the point. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC to avoid the spell. While its head is submerged in the water, the creature has disadvantage on Perception and Investigation checks unless it can see and hear underwater, it must hold its breath unless it can breathe underwater, and it is Silenced unless it can speak underwater.

A creature may attempt to momentarily escape by using an action to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a success, they are able to get a breath in, resetting their suffocation time.
If this spell is cast on a creature currently under the effects of an {@spell Air Bubble|COOMS} spell, it is dispelled before the effects of this spell take hold.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell on a willing creature using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can create two additional globes of saltwater on willing creatrues for each slot level above 3rd. When you cast this spell on an unwilling creature using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases by one minute for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Water Gonne

components.m: a gallon of water in a container within range, which the spell consumes

entries: You shoot a jet of pressurized water and make an attack roll at one enemy you can see within range. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} piercing damage and they are pushed back up to 15 feet, but not past the spell's range, as the stream of water abruptly stops there. If the creature comes into contact with a wall, creature, or some other stopping force during the forced movement, they stop moving and both parties take {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the piercing damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|2-9|1d8} and the range increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wild Cunning
entries: You sharpen your primal senses and attune to nature. While this spell is active:

items: If there are any tracks on the ground within range, you know where they are, and you make Wisdom (Survival) checks to follow these tracks with advantage until the end of this spell.
If there is edible forage within range, you know it and where to find it.
If there is clean drinking water within range, you know it and where to find it.
If there is suitable shelter for you and your companions with range, you know it and where to find it.

spell.name: Wood Shape
entries: You touch a nonmagical wooden object of Medium size or smaller or a section of wood no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. So, for example, you could shape a log into a weapon, idol, or coffer, or make a small passage through a wall, as long as the wall is less than 5 feet thick. You could also shape a door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

You can also use this spell to warp nonmagical wooden objects into being unusable. If the piece of wood you are attempting to warp is being worn or carried by a creature within range, make a melee spell attack against them. On a hit, you disfigure the nonmagical wooden object being worn or carried by the creature. A melee weapon receives a permanent -4 penalty to its attack rolls. A ranged weapon or shield warped by this spell becomes unusable. If the target creature is made of wood, you can choose to do this to their body instead. On a hit, you can choose to warp one of their arms as if they were a weapon affected by this spell or to warp one of their legs, halving their speed permanently. On a crit, you can choose to {@condition Blinded|PHB|blind}, mute, or {@condition Deafened|PHB|deafen} the creature permanently.

{@spell Wood Shape|COOMS} may be used to undo a warped object or creature, straightening them and restoring their original shape. In addition, a warped creature may have a limb straightened or one of the critical effects reversed by {@spell Wood Shape|COOMS} or by a restoration spell of 3rd level or greater.

spell.name: Wrathful Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened|phb} of you until the spell ends. As an action, the creature can make a Wisdom check against your spell save DC to steel its resolve and end this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wristpocket
entries: You flick your wrist, causing one object in your hand to vanish. The object, which only you can be holding and can weigh no more than 5 pounds, is transported to an extradimensional space, where it remains for the duration.

Until the spell ends, you can use your action to summon the object to your free hand, and you can use your action to return the object to the extradimensional space. An object still in the pocket plane when the spell ends appears in your space, at your feet.

You may have no more than two instances of this spell active at a time. Any more castings of this spell removes the oldest casting that is still active. The spell ends early if you are knocked unconscious.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a level of 4th level or higher, you can increase the amount of pounds the object can weigh by 5 pounds for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Zealous Accusation

components.m: a small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

entries: You hold up a piece of holy text written on parchment and declare the existence of those who would oppose you a sin, causing it to glow. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Charisma saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 1d12} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage type is based on the alignment of your deity: radiant for good, force for neutral, and necrotic for evil.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|2-9|1d12} for each slot level above 1st.
